structured_sections.heading: Applicability and Policy Statement
structured_sections.content: Stanford's policy is to apply the University's negotiated Facilities & Administrative (F&A) cost rate to all externally-sponsored projects. The Principal Investigator (PI) is responsible for the fiscal management of projects, including the application of the correct indirect cost rates in proposal budgets.

structured_sections.heading: General Waiver Policy
structured_sections.content: Under certain circumstances, the Vice Provost and Dean of Research (VPDoR) or their assignees may approve a full or partial waiver of F&A costs. However, waivers are not considered for projects sponsored by for-profit organizations, whether domestic or international.

structured_sections.heading: Pre-Approved Exceptions
structured_sections.content: Some sponsors or programs are pre-approved for an F&A cost waiver, typically because the sponsor requires it as a condition of the award. The Office of the VPDoR maintains a list of these pre-approved exceptions in the SeRA system. Stanford may accept a sponsor's lower rate if it is a written, publicly disclosed, and consistently applied policy, or if it's a condition of a specific solicitation. If a sponsor does not meet these criteria, a project-specific waiver is required. The university reserves the right to apply a higher rate if it becomes aware that a sponsor has paid a higher rate to another institution.

structured_sections.heading: Considerations for Pre-Approved Exceptions
structured_sections.content: Several factors guide the decision to grant a pre-approved waiver. Waivers will not be pre-approved for non-profit arms of for-profit organizations. A sponsor's desire to limit overhead on a single award is not sufficient grounds for a waiver. Waivers are not granted to fix incorrect cost classifications. Funding from foreign government agencies is not pre-approved and must be considered case-by-case.

structured_sections.heading: Case-by-Case Exceptions
structured_sections.content: The VPDoR (or the Dean of the School of Medicine for projects in that school) will consider case-by-case waiver requests in very limited circumstances. These requests must be approved by the PI and the school dean's office before being routed for exception. The decision is at the sole discretion of the VPDoR or Medical School Dean. Requests can be initiated from the budget page of the PDRF in SeRA.

structured_sections.heading: Criteria for Case-by-Case Exceptions
structured_sections.content: When evaluating a case-by-case request, the following factors may be considered: equity compared to other faculty projects, the total cost to Stanford, the likelihood of the award being jeopardized without a waiver, the benefit to new or junior faculty, the effect on student support, and evidence of the sponsor's capacity to pay the full overhead rate.

structured_sections.heading: Infrastructure Charge Policy
structured_sections.content: A waiver of F&A cost recovery does not waive the University's infrastructure charge, which is collected on the expenditure of restricted funds on non-federal sponsored projects. The specifics of this charge are detailed in Administrative Guide Memo 3.3.1.
